channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Congress Is Running Out of Excuses on the Debt
item.description: Congress must restore the credible expectation that emergency borrowing will be followed by years of small, steady primary surpluses.

item.title: White House pulls nomination of E.J. Antoni to lead Bureau of Labor Statistics
item.description: The White House late Tuesday withdrew the nomination of E. J. Antoni to serve as the next commissioner of the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

item.title: Judge rules USPS ban on guns is unconstitutional
item.description: The U.S. Postal Service policy banning people from bringing firearms into post offices violates the Constitution, a federal judge in Texas ruled Tuesd...

item.title: The Military Will Be Stronger for Pete Hegseth’s Commonsense Changes
item.description: The Pentagon is right to pursue a merit-based culture and high standards of physical fitness and training in order to deter and, if necessary, win war...

item.title: Pope intervenes in U.S. abortion debate by raising what it really means to be pro-life
item.description: Pope Leo XIV has intervened for the first time in an abortion dispute roiling the U.S. Catholic Church, raising the seeming contradiction over what it...

item.title: Exclusive: CUNY’s ‘Global Antifa’ Course Encourages Students To Aid Domestic Terrorists
item.description: The government must immediately remove any federal funding from schools that commiserate with terrorists and arrest anyone aiding them.

item.title: Blue States Embrace Fraud to Get Welfare for All
item.description: In states led by Democrats, the truly needy are being used as political pawns in a leftist game.

item.title: Top insurance company in hot seat as blistering new ad campaign exposes 'radical woke ideology'

item.title: Happy Gilmore 2: Golf and Unity
item.description: Sandler stares down Anderson.

item.title: People are talking to this AI startup’s cartoon panda as if it’s a therapist. The CEO is nervous because there’s no suicide prevention design
item.description: Users can set up a “panic button” but Earkick wasn't designed to be a suicide prevention app, said Karin Andrea Stephan, CEO and co-founder.

item.title: OpenAI says it’s worried about ‘doomscrolling, addiction, isolation, and … sloptimized feeds’ as it rolls out Sora social media app
item.description: The company it would “periodically poll users on their wellbeing” and give them options to adjust their feed, with a built-in bias to recommend posts ...

item.title: Trump presides over third government shutdown, with fresh opportunity to fire thousands of workers and close down federal offices
item.description: “We don’t want it to shut down,” Trump said at the White House before the midnight deadline, but he was unable to strike a deal.

item.title: How James Comey's indictment could go south for the DOJ

item.title: How this startup CTO went on to lead technology and AI for Thomson Reuters
item.description: Thomson Reuters has been scooping up startups to bolster the company's portfolio of tax and legal tools. That's kept CTO Joel Hron quite busy too.

item.title: DOJ Opens Probe Into Des Moines Schools As Illegal Alien Superintendent Resigns
item.description: DOJ says investigators will be looking into whether Iowa’s largest public school system is employing discriminatory DEI in hiring practices.

item.title: Federal judge rules public charter school violated church's First Amendment rights
item.description: A federal judge in Idaho found that a charter school's cancellation of a church lease for Sunday services was in violation of the First Amendment.

item.title: The Show Trial of Jeffrey Clark
item.description: The push to disbar the Trump official for ‘attempted dishonesty’ is a scary clown show.

item.title: Iowa ‘Criminal Illegal Alien’ School Superintendent Is On Maryland’s Active Voter List
item.description: Des Moines Schools Chief Ian Andre Roberts, who resigned in the wake of his ICE arrest, underscores the urgency of the SAVE Act.

item.title: It Turns Out The Military’s Biden-Era Recruitment Crisis Was A Leadership Problem After All
item.description: For first time in a long time, service members have leaders who actually give a damn about the mission and their well-being.

item.title: Madison Cawthorn aims to make political comeback, announces run for Congress
item.description: Cawthorn is running for Florida's 19th congressional seat, which will soon be vacated as Byron Donalds runs for governor.

item.title: Wealthy Southern California town sees 4 backyards fall into the ocean—but it’s not the ‘Portuguese Bend Landslide Complex’
item.description: Four backyards in Rancho Palos Verdes were damaged Saturday evening by significant soil movement from the sinking land, according to the city.
